intro: Odontarrhena trapeziformis, commonly known as the African orchid or the orchid of the savanna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, often fragrant floral structure. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish, with a distinctive trapezoidal shape, which gives it its scientific name. Odontarrhena trapeziformis is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns.
